title: Google reveals motion-sensing Pixel 4 phone as it challenges Apple on price
text:
Google has unveiled a new smartphone that can be controlled by moving hands in mid-air as the search giant presents its latest alternative to Apple’s iPhone.

The Pixel 4 comes a month after Apple unveiled the iPhone 11 and aims to compete with its rival's devices on price while also making technical strides it hopes can outdo Apple's new smartphone cameras.

Google's new phones are cheaper than last year's models, making it the latest firm to pare back its pricing as demand for smartphones slumps worldwide.

The devices start at £669, which undercuts Apple's £729 iPhone 11, and is significantly cheaper than the premium 11 Pro model, which costs at least £999.

Google's product chief Rick Osterloh revealed the new phones at an event in New York, alongside new home speakers, wireless earbuds and a laptop. The company, best known for its search engine and phone software, has branched into hardware in recent years as manufacturers seek to secure a future in wireless accessories and the smart home.

The Pixel 4 comes with a dual camera on the rear of the phone, with a distinctive camera bump similar to the design of Apple's new iPhone.

The company also revealed a new way of controlling a smartphone, dubbed “motion sense”. The technology uses a radar chip in the smartphone to let users control it using gestures in the air, with controls for skipping songs, snoozing an alarm or silencing calls.
description: Google has unveiled a new smartphone that can be controlled by moving hands in mid-air as the search giant presents its latest alternative to Apple’s iPhone.
